comments:
Hello,

A lot of peoples posted this error on the newsgroup but without any solution.

This error appear when creating the report file with the instruction : task.run()

This is the stack trace :
30 aout 2006 16:20:01 org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.data.dte.AbstractDataEngine prepare
GRAVE: Missing extenion id in data source definition, TextFile
org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.EngineException: Missing extenion id in data source definition, TextFile
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.adapter.ModelDteApiAdapter.newOdaDataSource(ModelDteApiAdapter.java:298)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.adapter.ModelDteApiAdapter.createDataSourceDesign(ModelDteApiAdapter.java:179)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.data.dte.AbstractDataEngine.prepare(AbstractDataEngine.java:152)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ReportExecutor.execute(ReportExecutor.java:101)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.internal.executor.l18n.LocalizedReportExecutor.execute(LocalizedReportExecutor.java:38)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.layout.html.HTMLReportLayoutEngine.layout(HTMLReportLayoutEngine.java:68)
at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RunAndRenderTask.run(RunAndRenderTask.java:187)
at Report.TestUsingBirt.executeReport(TestUsingBirt.java:66)
at Report.TestUsingBirt.main(TestUsingBirt.java:221)


The problem is the same when trying to generate either kind of file : .pdf or html. The data Source is a simple flat file, and the .rptdesign file seems correct :

        <oda-data-source extensionID="org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile" name="TextFile" id="4">
            <text-property name="displayName">Data Source</text-property>
            <property name="HOME">C:\birt2.0\pcsnv2</property>
            <property name="CHARSET">UTF-8</property>
            <property name="INCLTYPELINE">NO</property>
        </oda-data-source>


I am able to tell that inside the ModelDteApiAdapter class, source.getExtensionID() return null.


Regards, Bruno

Maya, can you attach your report design file? I cannot reproduce the bug in my local environment. 

This error only happen when the OdaDataSetHandle passed in without a valid extensionID.The part of report design file you attached seems correct,but to make further analysis we need first to reproduce the bug.

Created an attachment (id=49906)
Report design file

Created an attachment (id=49907)
Data source (flat file) for the transaction.rptdesign
In attachment the Report design file and the Data source file used (obp9.txt), Thanks

Hi Maya,

Using the attached report design file I still fail to reproduce the problem. Can you give me some more specific information on you environment to run the report? Did you ran the report using our BIRT all in one build, or just write code using BIRT API to generate the report? If the latter is the case have you initialize the OSGI framework before run the task?

Thanks!

Lin

Created an attachment (id=49915)
Code using BIRT API

Created an attachment (id=49916)
Stack trace of the error

Hi Lin,

Yes I am using BIRT API to generate the report (I also downladed BIRT full Eclipse Install).  

You asked me if I initialized the OSGI framework, what specific action to do that please ?

In attachment the code Jason Weathersby gave me, and the stack trace. May be you will see more information...

Kind Regards, 
Bruno

Hi Bruno,

After investigation we believe the problem is likely caused by bad configration.

I have used the code you attached. Only when I use incorrect class path the problem as you reported are reproduced.

When my class path file like follows(Project dependency):
==========================================
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<classpath>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="src"/>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER"/>
	<classpathentry combineaccessrules="false" kind="src" path="/org.eclipse.birt.core"/>
	<classpathentry combineaccessrules="false" kind="src" path="/org.eclipse.birt.report.engine"/>
	<classpathentry kind="output" path="bin"/>
</classpath>
==========================================
The bug is reproduced.

When my class path file like follows(Jar dependency):
==========================================
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<classpath>
	<classpathentry kind="src" path="src"/>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/coreapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/engineapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/chartengineapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/com.ibm.icu_3.4.4.1.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/commons-cli-1.0.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/commons-codec-1.3.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/dataadapterapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/dteapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/flute.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/js.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/modelapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/org.eclipse.emf.common_2.2.0.v200606051102.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi_2.2.0.v200606051102.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.2.0.v200606051102.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/sac.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="lib" path="C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/scriptapi.jar"/>
	<classpathentry kind="output" path="bin"/>
</classpath>
=================================================================

The attached code can generate correct result.

Could you please retry your code using new class path?

Thanks.
Lin

Dear Lin,

After using your class path, the report is generated now ! 
The problem was due indeed to a bag configuration. The classpath had too many .jar files imported (all from 'C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/lib/*' + some other from 'C:/birt-runtime-2_1_1/ReportEngine/plugins/.

Not easy to find, the error message was not really relevant. Many thanks for your efficiency.

I will add this information on newsgroup...

Kind Regards,
Bruno
setting the right class path solve this issue.

traces.message: Missing extenion id in data source definition, TextFile
